      • standardAddEvent

        private void standardAddEvent(java.lang.String jsonBody,
                    int expectedStatus,
                    int expectedNewEventNumber,
                    java.lang.String token)
        Simple useful function that generates "add event" test from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        jsonBody - : the request json body
        expectedStatus - : the expected Http response status
        expectedNewEventNumber - : the expected number of event in the table after running this test
        token - : the string corresponding to the current connected user (or null if there is not)

      • standardUpdateEvent

        private void standardUpdateEvent(java.lang.String jsonBody,
                       java.lang.String eventId,
                       int expectedStatus,
                       boolean checkNewValues,
                       java.lang.String expectedNewName,
                       java.lang.String expectedNewDescription,
                       java.lang.String token)
        Simple useful function that generates "update event" test from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        jsonBody - : the request json body
        eventId - : the id of the event to update
        expectedStatus - : the expected Http response status
        checkNewValues - : check or not the new values (name, description ...)
        expectedNewName - : the expected new event name
        expectedNewDescription - : the expected new event description
        token - : the string corresponding to the current connected user (or null if there is not)

      • standardDeleteEvent

        private void standardDeleteEvent(java.lang.String eventId,
                       int expectedStatus,
                       int expectedNewEventNumber,
                       java.lang.String token)
        Simple useful function that generates "delete event" test from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        eventId - : the id of the event to update
        expectedStatus - : the expected Http response status
        expectedNewEventNumber - : the expected number of event in the table after running this test
        token - : the string corresponding to the current connected user (or null if there is not)
